import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Get gender distribution from dataframe
gender_counts = df['Gender'].value_counts()

# Create pie chart
plt.pie(gender_counts, 
        labels=gender_counts.index,
        autopct='%1.1f%%',
        explode=[0.1, 0],
        colors=['blue', 'lightgreen'])

plt.title('Gender Distribution')
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Group the data by Sleep Disorder and calculate mean of Daily Steps
sleep_grouped = df.groupby('Sleep Disorder')['Daily Steps'].mean()

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sleep_grouped.plot(kind='bar', alpha=0.7)

plt.xlabel('Sleep Disorder Status')
plt.ylabel('Average Daily Steps')
plt.title('Comparison of Average Daily Steps by Sleep Disorder')

plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Assuming df is already loaded with the dataset
df['Physical Activity Level'] = df['Physical Activity Level'].fillna(0)
df['Quality of Sleep'] = df['Quality of Sleep'].fillna(0)

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(df['Physical Activity Level'], df['Quality of Sleep'])
plt.title('Relationship Between Physical Activity and Sleep Quality')
plt.xlabel('Physical Activity Level')
plt.ylabel('Quality of Sleep')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a frequency table for BMI categories
bmi_counts = df['BMI Category'].value_counts()

# Sort the categories in descending order
sorted_bmi = bmi_counts.sort_values(ascending=False)

# Create the bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.bar(sorted_bmi.index, sorted_bmi.values, color='skyblue')

# Add labels and title
plt.xlabel('BMI Category')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Distribution of BMI Categories')

# Rotate x-axis labels for better readability
plt.xticks(rotation=45)

# Adjust layout
plt.tight_layout()

# Save and display the chart
plt.savefig('bmi_distribution.png')
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Assuming df is already loaded with the provided data
avg_hr = df.groupby('Stress Level')['Heart Rate'].mean().reset_index()

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(avg_hr['Stress Level'], avg_hr['Heart Rate'], marker='o')
plt.title('Average Heart Rate by Stress Level')
plt.xlabel('Stress Level')
plt.ylabel('Average Heart Rate')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a scatter plot showing the relationship between age and sleep duration
df.plot.scatter(x='Age', y='Sleep Duration', colormap='viridis')

plt.xlabel('Age (years)')
plt.ylabel('Sleep Duration (hours)')
plt.grid(True)

plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig('age_sleep_duration.png')
plt.close()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Calculate average quality of sleep by occupation
average_sleep = df.groupby('Occupation')['Quality of Sleep'].mean()

# Sort by descending order of average quality
average_sleep = average_sleep.sort_values(ascending=False)

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
ax = average_sleep.plot(kind='bar')

plt.xticks(range(len(average_sleep.index)), average_sleep.index, rotation=45)
plt.xlabel('Occupation')
plt.ylabel('Average Quality of Sleep')
plt.title('Sleep Quality by Occupation')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Group by gender and calculate mean stress level
gender_stress = df.groupby('Gender')['Stress Level'].mean()

# Create bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
gender_stress.plot(kind='bar', color=['blue', 'red'])

plt.xticks([0, 1], ['Male', 'Female'], rotation=45)
plt.title('Average Stress Levels by Gender')
plt.ylabel('Average Stress Level')
plt.grid(True)

plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Count the occurrences of each sleep disorder
sleep_disorders = df['Sleep Disorder'].value_counts()

# Create labels and sizes for the pie chart
labels = sleep_disorders.index
sizes = sleep_disorders.values

# Plot the pie chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.pie(sizes, labels=labels, colors=['tab:red', 'tab:blue', 'tab:green', 'tab:yellow'], 
        autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
plt.title('Breakdown of Sleep Disorders')
plt.axis('equal')  
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create scatter plot of Daily Steps vs Heart Rate
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
df.plot.scatter(x='Daily Steps', y='Heart Rate', c='blue', label='Data Points')
plt.xlabel('Daily Steps (steps)')
plt.ylabel('Heart Rate (beats per minute)')
plt.title('Relationship Between Daily Steps and Heart Rate')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Group by Sleep Disorder and calculate mean Physical Activity Level
disorder_avg = df.groupby('Sleep Disorder')['Physical Activity Level'].mean()

# Create bar chart
disorder_avg.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6))

plt.xlabel('Sleep Disorder')
plt.ylabel('Average Physical Activity Level')
plt.title('Comparison of Average Physical Activity Levels by Sleep Disorder')
plt.grid(True)
plt.legend()
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
df.plot.scatter(x='Stress Level', y='Sleep Duration', c='blue', label='Data Points')
plt.xlabel('Stress Level')
plt.ylabel('Sleep Duration')
plt.title('Relationship Between Stress Level and Sleep Duration')
plt.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a histogram of age distribution
df['Age'].plot(kind='hist', bins=20, title='Age Distribution of Individuals')

plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
df.plot.scatter(x='Stress Level', y='Heart Rate', c='blue', label='Data Points')
plt.xlabel('Stress Level')
plt.ylabel('Heart Rate')
plt.title('Relationship Between Stress Level and Heart Rate')
plt.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.hist(df['Daily Steps'], bins=30, edgecolor='black', color='blue')
plt.xlabel('Daily Steps')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Distribution of Daily Steps')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Assuming df is already loaded with the dataset
x = df['Physical Activity Level']
y = df['Daily Steps']

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.xlabel('Physical Activity Level')
plt.ylabel('Daily Steps')
plt.title('Relationship Between Physical Activity Level and Daily Steps')
plt.grid(True)

plt.savefig('scatter_plot.png')
plt.close()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Calculate mean age for each occupation
mean_age_by_occupation = df.groupby('Occupation')['Age'].mean().sort_values(ascending=False)

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
mean_age_by_occupation.plot(kind='bar')
plt.xlabel('Occupation')
plt.ylabel('Average Age')
plt.title('Average Age by Occupation')
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Assuming df is already loaded with the dataset
stress_counts = df['Stress Level'].value_counts()

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.pie(stress_counts, labels=stress_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
plt.title('Proportion of People in Each Stress Level Category')
plt.legend(stress_counts.index, title='Stress Levels')
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Extract age and heart rate data from dataframe df
age = df['Age'].values
heart_rate = df['Heart Rate'].values

# Create scatter plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(age, heart_rate, marker='o', facecolors='blue')

# Add title and labels
plt.title('Relationship Between Age and Heart Rate')
plt.xlabel('Age (years)')
plt.ylabel('Heart Rate (bpm)')

# Add grid lines
plt.grid(True)

# Show plot
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Calculate average sleep duration for males and females
gender_sleep = df.groupby('Gender')['Sleep Duration'].mean()

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.bar(gender_sleep.index, gender_sleep.values)

plt.title('Average Sleep Duration by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Average Sleep Duration (hours)')
plt.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
df['Quality of Sleep'].hist(bins=10)
plt.title('Distribution of Quality of Sleep')
plt.xlabel('Quality of Sleep')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.show()
